detailed_translations.english: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

name: earth
trans: n. 地球；地表，陆地；土地，土壤；尘事，俗事；兽穴
vt. 把（电线） 接地；盖（土）；追赶入洞穴

sentences.english: the planet Earth
sentences.chinese: 地球

sentences.english: The earth shook.
sentences.chinese: 大地晃动了。

detailed_translations.english: the planet that we live on

name: inner
trans: adj. 内部的；内心的；精神的

sentences.english: an inner room
sentences.chinese: 内室

sentences.english: inner London
sentences.chinese: 伦敦中心区

sentences.english: the inner ear
sentences.chinese: 内耳

sentences.english: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽使我感到内心平和。

detailed_translations.english: on the inside or close to the centre of something

name: literature
trans: n. 文学；文献；文艺；著作

sentences.english: He has read many of the major works of literature.
sentences.chinese: 他读过许多重要的文学作品。

sentences.english: Italian literature
sentences.chinese: 意大利文学

sentences.english: literature on the history of science
sentences.chinese: 科学史的文献资料

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学，文学作品；文献；文献
detailed_translations.english: books, plays, poems etc that people think are important and good

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: payment
trans: n. 付款，支付；报酬，报答；偿还；惩罚，报应

sentences.english: She demanded payment in advance.
sentences.chinese: 她要求预先付款。

sentences.english: Payment can be made by cheque or credit card.
sentences.chinese: 可以用支票或信用卡付款。

detailed_translations.english: the act of paying for something

sentences.english: ...the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

detailed_translations.english: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

name: somewhat
trans: adv. 有点；多少；几分；稍微

sentences.english: Things have changed somewhat since then.
sentences.chinese: 从那时候起，情况就有些不一样了。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little but not very

sentences.english: a heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 心脏专科医生

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, or is very skilled at it

name: truly
trans: adv. 真实地，不假；真诚地

sentences.english: His work is truly original.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品确实十分独特。

sentences.english: Fawcett was a truly remarkable man.
sentences.chinese: 福西特是一位真正不同凡响的人。

sentences.english: a truly great work of medieval literature
sentences.chinese: 一部真正伟大的中世纪文学作品

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that the way you are describing something is really true

name: vessel
trans: n. 船，舰； 脉管，血管；容器，器皿

sentences.english: a fishing vessel
sentences.chinese: 渔船

sentences.english: a burst blood vessel
sentences.chinese: 破裂的血管

sentences.english: a Bronze Age drinking vessel
sentences.chinese: 青铜器时代的饮具

detailed_translations.english: a ship or large boat

name: aid
trans: n. 援助；帮助；助手；帮助者

sentences.english: He was breathing only with the aid of a ventilator.
sentences.chinese: 他只有靠呼吸器呼吸。

sentences.english: first aid
sentences.chinese: 急救；急救护理

detailed_translations.english: help that you need to do a particular thing

name: asset
trans: n. 资产；优点；有用的东西；有利条件；财产；有价值的人或物

sentences.english: the value of a company’s assets
sentences.chinese: 公司的资产价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 资产， 财产； 有价值的特性或技能， 优点
detailed_translations.english: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

name: automatic
trans: n. 自动机械；自动手枪
adj. 自动的；无意识的；必然的

sentences.english: an automatic weapon
sentences.chinese: 自动武器

sentences.english: an automatic gearbox
sentences.chinese: 自动变速箱

sentences.english: My camera is fully automatic .
sentences.chinese: 我的照相机是全自动的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自动的； 必然发生的； 无意识的
detailed_translations.english: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process
a weapon that can fire bullets continuously

name: background
trans: adj. 背景的；发布背景材料的

sentences.english: Students with a background in chemistry will probably find the course easier.
sentences.chinese: 学过化学的学生可能会觉得这门课程容易些。

sentences.english: It’s important to understand other people, people from different backgrounds .
sentences.chinese: 要理解别人，理解那些来自不同背景的人，这是很重要的。

sentences.english: Do you know anything about his background?
sentences.chinese: 关于他的背景，你知道什么吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 出身背景， 经历； 背景资料； 背景， 底子
detailed_translations.english: someone’s family, education, previous work etc

sentences.english: Don’t blame me – it’s not my fault.
sentences.chinese: 别来怪我——又不是我的错。

sentences.english: I blame his mother. She does everything for him.
sentences.chinese: 怪他母亲不好，她什么事都要为他做。

detailed_translations.english: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

name: circumstance
trans: n. 环境，情况；事件；境遇

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: collapse
trans: vt. 使倒塌，使崩溃；使萎陷；折叠

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: combination
trans: n. 结合；组合；联合； 化合

sentences.english: a combination nightclub and café
sentences.chinese: 夜总会兼咖啡馆

detailed_translations.english: two or more different things that exist together or are used or put together

name: competitive
trans: adj. 竞争的；比赛的；求胜心切的

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

sentences.english: These are the report’s main conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

name: connection
trans: n. 连接；关系；人脉；连接件

sentences.english: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.english: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
sentences.chinese: 证据就在档案里，但没有人把它们联系起来。

sentences.english: Students often see little connection between school and the rest of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 学生往往看不到上学和今后生活的联系。

sentences.english: He demonstrated the close connection between social conditions and health.
sentences.chinese: 他证明了社会条件和健康之间的密切联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连接； 联系； 连接物， 连接点； 亲戚
detailed_translations.english: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

name: corporate
trans: adj. 法人的；共同的，全体的；社团的；公司的；企业的

sentences.english: The company is moving its corporate headquarters (= main offices ) from New York to Houston.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.english: Vince is vice-president of corporate communications.
sentences.chinese: 文斯是负责企业宣传的副总裁。

sentences.english: Corporate America is not about to be converted to the environmentalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 美国企业界不打算投身环保事业。

sentences.english: changing the corporate culture (= the way that people in a corporation think and behave ) to accept family-friendly policies
sentences.chinese: 改变公司文化，采取更关怀家庭的政策

sentences.english: an advertising campaign intended to reinforce our corporate identity
sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.english: The yacht can be hired for corporate hospitality (= entertainment provided by companies for their customers ) .
sentences.chinese: 可以租下这艘游艇用于公司招待客户。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法人团体的， 公司的； 全体的， 共同的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to a corporation

name: correct
trans: adj. 正确的；恰当的；端正的

sentences.english: If my calculations are correct, we’re about ten miles from Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 如果我计算得没错的话，我们离埃克塞特大约十英里。

sentences.english: Score one point for each correct answer .
sentences.chinese: 答对一题得一分。

sentences.english: You are absolutely correct, the Missouri is the longest river in the US.
sentences.chinese: 你说的完全正确，密苏里河是美国最长的河流。

sentences.english: Some eyesight problems are relatively easy to correct.
sentences.chinese: 有些视力问题比较容易矫正。

detailed_translations.english: having no mistakes
to make something right or to make it work the way it should

sentences.english: Such a database would be extremely costly to set up.
sentences.chinese: 建立这样一个数据库要花很多钱。

sentences.english: His delay in making a decision could prove costly in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 他的优柔寡断长久下去要付出巨大代价。

detailed_translations.english: very expensive, especially wasting a lot of money

name: counter
trans: n. 柜台；对立面；计数器；（某些棋盘游戏的）筹码
vi. 逆向移动，对着干；反驳
vt. 反击，还击；反向移动，对着干；反驳，回答
adv. 反方向地；背道而驰地

sentences.english: He wondered if the girl behind the counter recognised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在想柜台后面的那个女孩是否认出了他。

sentences.english: Set the video counter to zero before you press play.
sentences.chinese: 在按播放键之前，把录像机上的计数器调到零。

detailed_translations.english: the place where you pay or are served in a shop, bank, restaurant etc

name: crash
trans: n. 撞碎；坠毁；破产；轰隆声；睡觉
vi. 摔碎；坠落；发出隆隆声；(金融企业等)破产
vt. 打碎；使坠毁、撞坏；擅自闯入

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产
detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

sentences.english: The bathroom is decorated in green and yellow.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里是用绿色和黄色装潢的。

sentences.english: We plan to spend the weekend decorating.
sentences.chinese: 我们计划用这个周末来装修。

detailed_translations.english: to paint the inside of a room, put special paper on the walls etc

name: depress
trans: vt. 压抑；使沮丧；使萧条

sentences.english: The thought of taking the exam again depressed him.
sentences.chinese: 想到要补考，他就心情沮丧。

sentences.english: It depresses me that nobody seems to care.
sentences.chinese: 似乎没有人在乎，这让我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Depress the clutch fully.
sentences.chinese: 把离合器踩到底。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very unhappy

name: disappear
trans: vi. 消失；失踪；不复存在

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

sentences.english: Aspirin may discourage tumour growth in some types of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 阿司匹林可能遏制某些恶性肿瘤的生长。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less likely to happen

sentences.english: severe eating disorders such as bulimia and anorexia
sentences.chinese: 像贪食症和厌食症这类严重的进食障碍

detailed_translations.chinese: 混乱， 杂乱， 骚乱
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a lot of people behave in an uncontrolled, noisy, or violent way in public

name: distinguish
trans: vt. 区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

sentences.english: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 效率； 功效， 效能
detailed_translations.english: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: employ
trans: vt. 使用，采用；雇用；使忙于，使从事于

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

name: engagement
trans: n. 婚约；约会；交战；诺言
n. 参与度（指用户点赞、转发、评论、下载文档、观看视频、咨询等交互行为）

sentences.english: Their engagement was announced in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们订婚的消息在报上公布了。

sentences.english: This is his only public speaking engagement on the tour.
sentences.chinese: 这是他此行唯一一场公开演讲。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged

name: estimate
trans: n. 估计，估价；判断，看法
vt. 估计，估量；判断，评价

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: exchange
trans: n. 交换；交流；交易所；兑换

sentences.english: We exchange gifts at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我们在圣诞节时交换礼物。

sentences.english: It’s a place where people can chat and exchange ideas.
sentences.chinese: 在这个地方人们可以聊天和交流想法。

sentences.english: Four of my cassettes for your Madonna CD is a fair exchange.
sentences.chinese: 我用四盒磁带换你的麦当娜激光唱片很公平。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something and receive the same kind of thing from them at the same time
the act of giving someone something and receiving something else from them

name: existence
trans: n. 存在，实在；生存，生活；存在物，实在物

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

name: expose
trans: vt. 揭露，揭发；使曝光；显示

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: extend
trans: vt. 延伸；扩大；推广；伸出；给予；使竭尽全力；对…估价
vi. 延伸；扩大；伸展；使疏开

sentences.english: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

detailed_translations.english: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer

sentences.english: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency.
sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents
sentences.chinese: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something happens a lot

sentences.english: Britain could grant Spain’s request .
sentences.chinese: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。

sentences.english: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
sentences.chinese: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for

name: highlight
trans: n. 最精彩的部分；最重要的事情；加亮区
vt. 突出；强调；使显著；加亮

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: induce
trans: vt. 诱导；引起；引诱；感应

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: instant
trans: adj. 立即的；紧急的；紧迫的

sentences.english: an instant success
sentences.chinese: 马到成功

sentences.english: a system that provides instant access to client information
sentences.chinese: 能立即查到客户信息的系统

sentences.english: The women took an instant dislike to one another.
sentences.chinese: 这些女人立刻就彼此厌恶起来。

sentences.english: The programme brought an instant response.
sentences.chinese: 节目立即引起了反响。

sentences.english: For an instant, Barney was tempted to flee.
sentences.chinese: 那一瞬间，巴尼很想逃走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 立即的； 紧急的； 可以速食的
detailed_translations.english: happening or produced immediately
An instant is an extremely short period of time

name: interactive
trans: adj. 交互式的；相互作用的

sentences.english: interactive computer systems
sentences.chinese: 交互式电脑系统

sentences.english: the museum’s interactive exhibits
sentences.chinese: 博物馆的互动展品

detailed_translations.chinese: 互相作用的，互相影响的
detailed_translations.english: an interactive computer program, television system etc allows you to communicate directly with it, and does things in reaction to your actions

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: liberal
trans: adj. 自由主义的；慷慨的；不拘泥的；宽大的

sentences.english: I had quite liberal parents.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母思想很开明。

sentences.english: a liberal supply of drinks
sentences.chinese: 饮料的充足供应

detailed_translations.english: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings

name: multiple
trans: adj. 多重的；多样的；许多的

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

sentences.english: a novel by Jane Austen
sentences.chinese: 简·奥斯丁的小说

sentences.english: What a novel idea!.
sentences.chinese: 多么新奇的想法呀！

detailed_translations.english: a long written story in which the characters and events are usually imaginary
not like anything known before, and unusual or interesting

name: objective
trans: adj. 客观的；目标的；宾格的
n. 目的；目标； 物镜；宾格

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: optimistic
trans: adj. 乐观的；乐观主义的

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: peak
trans: n. 山峰；最高点；顶点；帽舌
vt. 使达到最高点；使竖起
vi. 消瘦；到达最高点；变憔悴

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: phenomenon
trans: n. 现象；奇迹；杰出的人才

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

name: plastic
trans: n. 塑料制品；整形；可塑体
adj. 塑料的；（外科）造型的；可塑的

sentences.english: a plastic spoon
sentences.chinese: 塑料汤匙

sentences.english: plastic bags
sentences.chinese: 塑料袋

detailed_translations.english: made of plastic

name: presence
trans: n. 存在；出席；参加；风度；仪态

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率；生产能力

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

name: profitable
trans: adj. 有利可图的；赚钱的；有益的

sentences.english: The advertising campaign proved very profitable.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明，这次广告宣传活动卓有成效。

sentences.english: a highly profitable business
sentences.chinese: 盈利高的企业

sentences.english: a profitable afternoon
sentences.chinese: 有收获的下午

detailed_translations.english: producing a profit or a useful result

name: properly
trans: adv. 适当地；正确地；恰当地

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

name: rarely
trans: adv. 很少地；难得；罕有地

sentences.english: We rarely see someone go after the health area.
sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: He rarely mingles with other students on the campus.
sentences.chinese: 他很少和校园里的其他学生交往。

name: reaction
trans: n. 反应，感应；反动，复古；反作用

sentences.english: What was Jeff’s reaction when you told him about the job?
sentences.chinese: 你告诉杰夫这个工作时，他是什么反应？

detailed_translations.english: something that you feel or do because of something that has happened or been said

sentences.english: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
sentences.chinese: 她叫他走，但他不肯。

trans: adv. 的确；实在；真正地；甚至

sentences.chinese: 使携带身份证成为法定要求的计划

sentences.chinese: 她吃了几片头痛药。

sentences.chinese: 小麦地

sentences.chinese: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

sentences.chinese: 他们达成协议，平分利润。

sentences.chinese: 他们商量后，他会不会同意去看望继母？

sentences.chinese: 那只动物突然警觉地抬起头来。

sentences.chinese: 戴夫突然结婚，令朋友们非常吃惊。

sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.

sentences.chinese: 马克把我拉到一边给我解释这个问题。

sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

name: attractive

sentences.chinese: 妩媚动人的年轻女子

sentences.english: Women seem to find him attractive .
sentences.chinese: 女性似乎觉得他很有吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有吸引力的， 引起注意的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is attractive is good looking, especially in a way that makes you sexually interested in them

sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

name: capital

adj. 首都的；重要的；大写的

sentences.english: capital investments

detailed_translations.english: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

name: complaint

sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: component
trans: n. 成分；组件； 元件

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: concentrate
trans: vi. 集中；浓缩；全神贯注；聚集

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: conclude
trans: vt. 推断；决定，作结论；结束

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

sentences.english: wildlife conservation
sentences.chinese: 野生生物保护

sentences.english: a local conservation group
sentences.chinese: 当地的一个环境保护团体

detailed_translations.english: the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, forests etc, to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed

name: contemporary
trans: n. 同时代的人；同时期的东西
adj. 当代的；同时代的；属于同一时期的

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

sentences.english: All the money has been raised by voluntary contribution.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些钱都是靠自愿捐献筹集的。

detailed_translations.english: something that you give or do in order to help something be successful

name: convenient
trans: adj. 方便的；适当的；近便的；实用的

sentences.english: Mail-order catalogs are a convenient way to shop.
sentences.chinese: 使用邮购目录是一种方便的购物方式。

sentences.english: My secretary will call you to arrange a convenient time to meet.
sentences.chinese: 我的秘书会打电话给你安排一个方便的时间见面。

sentences.english: restaurants convenient for shops and theatres
sentences.chinese: 靠近商店和剧院的餐厅

detailed_translations.english: useful to you because it saves you time, or does not spoil your plans or cause you problems

name: corps
trans: n. 军团；兵种；兵队；（德国大学的）学生联合会

sentences.english: My corps ! your corps ! our corps ! maring corps !
sentences.chinese: 我的、你的、大家的海军陆战队！

sentences.english: The corps' corn in the corner is scorned by the stubborn corporation.
sentences.chinese: 军团在角落里的谷物受到了顽固的公司司（社团）的嘲笑。

detailed_translations.english: a trained army unit made of two or more  divisions (= groups of soldiers )

sentences.english: Davis was found not guilty on all counts .
sentences.chinese: 戴维斯受到指控的各项罪名均不成立。

detailed_translations.english: one of the crimes that someone is charged with

name: court
trans: n. 法院；球场；朝廷；奉承
vt. 招致（失败、危险等）；向…献殷勤；设法获得

sentences.english: It could not be proved in a court of law.
sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

sentences.english: The court case lasted six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼持续了六个星期。

sentences.english: Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
sentences.chinese: 今天将有四个人因被指控犯有欺诈罪出庭受审。

sentences.english: The court ruled that no compensation was due.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判决不予赔偿。

sentences.english: She threatened to take the magazine to court (= take legal action against them ) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
sentences.chinese: 她威胁说如果这家杂志不立刻刊登道歉声明，她就要把他们告上法庭。

detailed_translations.english: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

name: creation
trans: n. 创造，创作；创作物，产物

sentences.english: a job creation scheme
sentences.chinese: 创造就业机会的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创建； 创造的作品， 产物； 宇宙， 天地万物
detailed_translations.english: the act of creating something

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

name: cure
trans: n. 治疗；治愈； 疗法
vt. 治疗；治愈；使硫化；加工处理
vi. 治病；痊愈；受治疗；被硫化；被加工处理

sentences.english: Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
sentences.chinese: 医生，你能把他治好吗？

sentences.english: The new treatment effected a miraculous cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种新疗法产生了奇迹般的疗效。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
the act of making someone well again after an illness

name: deliver
trans: vt. 交付；发表；递送；释放；给予（打击）；给…接生
vi. 实现；传送；履行；投递

sentences.english: The morning mail has just been delivered.
sentences.chinese: 早晨的邮件刚送到。

sentences.english: Do you deliver on Saturdays?
sentences.chinese: 星期六你们送货吗？

sentences.english: I’m having some flowers delivered for her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我在安排人给她送花祝贺生日。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

name: distraction
trans: n. 注意力分散；消遣；心烦意乱

sentences.english: I study in the library as there are too many distractions at home.
sentences.chinese: 我在图书馆学习，家里分心的事太多。

detailed_translations.english: something that stops you paying attention to what you are doing

name: division
trans: n.  除法；部门；分配；分割；师（军队）；赛区

sentences.english: the division sign (÷)
sentences.chinese: 除号

sentences.english: the Computer Services Division
sentences.chinese: 电脑维修部

detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out how many times one number is contained in another

name: dramatic
trans: adj. 戏剧的；急剧的；引人注目的；激动人心的

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: efficient
trans: adj. 有效率的；有能力的；生效的

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

name: emergency
trans: n. 紧急情况；突发事件；非常时刻

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.english: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

name: emission
trans: n. （光、热等的）发射，散发；喷射；发行

sentences.english: the emission of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 向大气排放二氧化碳

sentences.english: Britain agreed to cut emissions of nitrogen oxide from power stations.
sentences.chinese: 英国同意减少发电站氮氧化物的排放量。

detailed_translations.english: the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.

name: entitle
trans: vt. 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: excess
trans: n. 超过，超额；过度，过量；无节制
adj. 额外的，过量的；附加的

sentences.english: The government was unable to curb the excesses of the secret police.
sentences.chinese: 政府无法约束秘密警察的过分行为。

sentences.english: the worst excesses of journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作中那些最糟糕的越轨行为

detailed_translations.english: harmful actions that are socially or morally unacceptable

sentences.english: 13 people were summarily executed (= killed without any trial or legal process ) by the guerrillas.
sentences.chinese: 有13人被游击队员就地处决。

sentences.english: The job involves drawing up and executing a plan of nursing care.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作包括拟订和实施一个护理计划。

detailed_translations.english: to kill someone, especially legally as a punishment

name: extraordinary
trans: adj. 非凡的；特别的；离奇的；临时的；特派的

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.english: The U.S. has called for an extraordinary emergency meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission to examine the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非同寻常的；特别的（会议）
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

name: ideal
trans: adj. 理想的；完美的；想象的；不切实际的

sentences.english: advice on how to reach your ideal weight
sentences.chinese: 如何达到理想体重的建议

sentences.english: The scheme offers an ideal opportunity for youngsters to get training.
sentences.chinese: 该计划为年轻人提供了获得培训的极好机会。

sentences.english: With so much rain, conditions are far from ideal.
sentences.chinese: 雨水这么多，天气情况很不理想。

detailed_translations.english: the best or most suitable that something could possibly be
a principle about what is morally right or a perfect standard that you hope to achieve

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

name: inspire
trans: vt. 激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: instruction
trans: n. 指令，命令；指示；教导；用法说明

sentences.english: (= I have been told ) to give the package to him personally.
sentences.chinese: 我接到的指示是亲手把包裹交给他。

sentences.english: Make sure you carry out the doctor’s instructions.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要遵照医生的嘱咐。

sentences.english: The school gives instruction in first aid.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校教授急救课

detailed_translations.english: a statement telling someone what they must do

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

name: mood
trans: n. 情绪，语气；心境；气氛

sentences.english: You’re in a good mood this morning!
sentences.chinese: 你今天早晨心情不错啊！

sentences.english: the general mood of depression in the office
sentences.chinese: 办公室里普遍的沮丧情绪

detailed_translations.english: the way you feel at a particular time

name: otherwise
trans: adv. 否则；另外；在其他方面
adj. 另外的；其他方面的；原本，本来

sentences.english: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
sentences.chinese: 他除了累身体很好。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见远处车流的声音，除此之外，一切都很安静。

sentences.english: This spoiled an otherwise excellent piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。

sentences.english: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: except for what has just been mentioned

name: permanent
trans: adj. 永久的，永恒的；不变的

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: pose
trans: vi. 摆姿势；佯装；矫揉造作
vt. 造成，形成；摆姿势；装模作样；提出…讨论
n. 姿势，姿态；装模作样

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: preserve
trans: n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品
vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: propose
trans: vt. 建议；打算，计划；求婚

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: recovery
trans: n. 恢复，复原；痊愈；重获

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: regardless
trans: adj. 不管的；不顾的；不注意的
adv. 不顾后果地；不管怎样，无论如何；不惜费用地

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

name: renew
trans: vt. 使更新；续借；续费；复兴；重申

sentences.english: The window frames need to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 窗框需要换新的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

name: represent
trans: vt. 代表；表现；描绘；回忆；再赠送

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.

trans: n. 承诺，保证；委托；承担义务；献身

sentences.english: Are you ready to make a long-term commitment ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否准备好作出长久的承诺？

detailed_translations.english: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: constant
trans: adj. 不变的；恒定的；经常的

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: convince
trans: vt. 说服；使确信，使信服

sentences.english: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我很快就使他相信我是清白的，但是他还是非常怀疑我精神是否正常。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

name: corner
trans: n. 角落，拐角处；地区，偏僻处；困境，窘境
vt. 垄断；迫至一隅；使陷入绝境；把…难住

sentences.english: He pulled a dirty handkerchief out by its corner and waved it at me.
sentences.chinese: 他拽出一块脏手帕，捏着一角向我挥动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 角落，拐角处；地区，偏僻处；困境，窘境
detailed_translations.english: the point at which two lines or edges meet

name: crucial
trans: adj. 重要的；决定性的；定局的；决断的

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: custom
trans: n. 习惯，惯例；风俗；海关，关税；经常光顾；（经常性的）顾客

sentences.english: She was stopped at customs and questioned.
sentences.chinese: 她在海关被叫住接受问话。

sentences.english: It took ages to clear customs (= be allowed through customs ) but then we were out of the airport quite quickly.
sentences.chinese: 过海关花了很长时间，不过出机场倒是很快。

sentences.english: You won’t be able to take that through customs.
sentences.chinese: 你带着那东西过不了海关的。

detailed_translations.english: the place where your bags are checked for illegal goods when you go into a country

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

sentences.english: What have I done to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我做了什么事，要得到这样的报应？

sentences.english: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better (= deserve to be treated in a better way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我为这些孩子感到难过，他们应该过得更好。

sentences.english: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。

sentences.english: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
sentences.chinese: 应该特别提一下葆拉，她给了我们许多帮助。

sentences.english: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会打人，哪怕他欠揍。

sentences.english: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
sentences.chinese: 他做了什么，竟会受到这样的惩罚？

sentences.english: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

detailed_translations.english: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

name: diploma
trans: n. 毕业证书，学位证书；公文，文书；奖状

sentences.english: a High School diploma
sentences.chinese: 高中毕业文凭

detailed_translations.english: a document showing that a student has successfully completed their high school or university education

name: discrimination
trans: n. 歧视；区别，辨别；识别力

sentences.english: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

sentences.english: an employee’s average weekly earnings
sentences.chinese: 雇员的平均周薪

sentences.english: The company’s earnings have dropped by 5% in the first quarter.
sentences.chinese: 公司第一季度的利润下降了5%。

detailed_translations.english: the money that you receive for the work that you do

name: elementary
trans: adj. 基本的；初级的； 元素的

sentences.english: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
sentences.chinese: 正义和民主的基本信条

sentences.english: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

sentences.english: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
sentences.chinese: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。

detailed_translations.english: simple or basic

name: evil
trans: adj. 邪恶的；不幸的；有害的；讨厌的

sentences.english: She wanted to protect her children from the evils of the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。

sentences.english: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。

sentences.english: the evils of capitalism
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的种种祸害

sentences.english: There is too much evil in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世上的罪恶太多。

sentences.english: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
sentences.chinese: 对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者

detailed_translations.english: something that is very bad or harmful
someone who is evil deliberately does very cruel things to harm other people

sentences.english: the theory of evolution
sentences.chinese: 进化论

detailed_translations.english: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: excessive
trans: adj. 过多的，极度的；过分的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

sentences.english: She told the court she would give a full explanation of the prosecution's decision on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉法庭她将在星期一就控方的决定做出详尽的解释。

detailed_translations.english: a statement, fact, or situation that tells you why sth happened; a reason given for sth

name: faculty
trans: n. 科，系；能力；全体教员

sentences.english: Both faculty and students oppose the measures.
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生都反对这些措施。

detailed_translations.english: all the teachers in a university

name: folk
trans: n. 民族；人们；亲属（复数）

sentences.english: I’m sure there are some folk who would rather they weren’t here.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定有些人宁愿自己不在这里。

sentences.english: Thanks to the folks at NBC.
sentences.chinese: 感谢全国广播公司的工作人员。

sentences.english: Is it OK if I call my folks?
sentences.chinese: 我打电话给家里人可以吗？

detailed_translations.english: people

name: frequent
trans: adj. 频繁的；时常发生的；惯常的
vt. 常到，常去；时常出入于

sentences.english: Trains rushed past at frequent intervals .
sentences.chinese: 火车频频驶过。

sentences.english: She was a frequent visitor to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她是家里的常客。

detailed_translations.english: happening or doing something often
to go to a particular place often

name: genuine
trans: adj. 真实的，真正的；诚恳的

sentences.english: ‘Did he really?’ Her surprise seemed genuine.
sentences.chinese: “他真的这样？”她好像是真的惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

name: grab
trans: n. 攫取；霸占；夺取之物
vt. 攫取；霸占；将…深深吸引

sentences.english: I grabbed my bag and ran off.
sentences.chinese: 我抓起我的包就跑。

sentences.english: Two men grabbed her and pushed her to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子抓住她，把她推倒在地上。

sentences.english: Kay grabbed hold of my arm to stop herself falling.
sentences.chinese: 凯抓住我的手臂，以免自己摔倒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓取，攫取；赶紧做；抓住；抓，夺
detailed_translations.english: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement
to suddenly try to take hold of something

name: grid
trans: n. 网格；格子，栅格；输电网

sentences.english: the national grid
sentences.chinese: 国家电网

detailed_translations.english: the network of electricity supply wires that connects  power stations  and provides electricity to buildings in an area

name: identity
trans: n. 身份；同一性，一致；特性；恒等式

sentences.english: The identity of the killer is still unknown.
sentences.chinese: 凶手的身份仍未查明。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s identity is their name or who they are

name: initial
trans: vt. 用姓名的首字母签名

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

name: innovative
trans: adj. 革新的，创新的；新颖的；有创新精神的

sentences.english: an innovative approach to language teaching
sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.english: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

detailed_translations.english: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: intense
trans: adj. 强烈的；紧张的；非常的；热情的

sentences.english: Young people today are under intense pressure to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如今的年轻人面临要出人头地的巨大压力。

sentences.english: the intense heat of the desert
sentences.chinese: 沙漠的炽热

sentences.english: The pain was so intense I couldn’t sleep.
sentences.chinese: 疼得我都睡不着觉。

sentences.english: He took an intense interest in all religious matters.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有宗教事宜都很感兴趣。

sentences.english: a look of intense dislike
sentences.chinese: 极端厌恶的表情

sentences.english: The job demands intense concentration.
sentences.chinese: 这工作需要全神贯注。

detailed_translations.english: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

sentences.english: Industrial relations should be free from state interference.
sentences.chinese: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

detailed_translations.english: an act of interfering

sentences.english: government intervention to regulate prices
sentences.chinese: 政府介入控制物价

detailed_translations.english: the act of becoming involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: involvement
trans: n. 牵连；包含；混乱；财政困难

sentences.english: School officials say they welcome parental involvement.
sentences.chinese: 校方说他们欢迎学生父母参与。

name: length
trans: n. 长度，长；时间的长短；（语）音长

sentences.english: We measured the length and width of the living room.
sentences.chinese: 我们量了客厅的长和宽。

sentences.english: You’ll need several pieces of string of different lengths.
sentences.chinese: 你需要几根长度不等的绳子。

sentences.english: a length of rope/pipe/wire etc
sentences.chinese: 一段绳子/管子/电线等

detailed_translations.english: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

sentences.english: The ancient Chinese claimed that garlic promoted longevity.
sentences.chinese: 中国古人说蒜能延寿。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of time that someone or something lives

name: occasion
trans: n. 时机，机会；场合；理由

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

name: pack
trans: n. 包装；一群；背包；包裹；一副
vt. 包装；压紧；捆扎；挑选；塞满
vi. 挤；包装货物；被包装；群集

sentences.english: I forgot to pack my razor.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记把剃须刀放入行李包了。

sentences.english: Hundreds of people packed into the mosque.
sentences.chinese: 成百上千的人挤进了清真寺。

sentences.english: Send away for your free information pack today.
sentences.chinese: 今天就来函索取免费资料包吧。

detailed_translations.english: to put things into cases, bags etc ready for a trip somewhere
something wrapped in paper or packed in a box and then sent by post or taken somewhere

name: persuade
trans: vt. 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: plunge
trans: vt. 使陷入；使投入；使插入
vi. 突然地下降；投入；陷入；跳进

sentences.english: The government's political and economic reforms threaten to plunge the country into chaos.
sentences.chinese: 该政府的政治和经济改革有可能使这个国家陷入混乱之中。

sentences.english: Eddy found himself plunged into a world of brutal violence.
sentences.chinese: 埃迪发现自己突然陷入了一个残酷暴力的世界。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth experience sth unpleasant

name: praise
trans: n. 赞扬；称赞；荣耀；崇拜

sentences.english: It’s important to give children plenty of praise and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 对小孩子多加表扬和鼓励是很重要的。

sentences.english: Her teacher was full of praise for her work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对她的作业赞不绝口。

sentences.english: His first novel received high praise .
sentences.chinese: 他的第一部小说受到了高度赞扬。

sentences.english: Gregory was singled out (= he was chosen in particular ) for special praise .
sentences.chinese: 格雷戈里被单独给予特别表扬。

sentences.english: The film has won praise from audiences and critics alike.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影赢得了观众和评论家的一致赞誉。

sentences.english: Jane was praised by her teacher.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：简受到了老师的表扬。

detailed_translations.english: words that you say or write in order to praise someone or something
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly

sentences.english: Guyana's railways were previously owned by private companies.
sentences.chinese: 圭亚那的铁路先前为私营公司所拥有。

sentences.english: The contract was awarded to a previously unknown company.
sentences.chinese: 该合同给了一家先前不知名的公司。

detailed_translations.english: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about

name: primarily
trans: adv. 首先；主要地，根本上

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

name: prompt
trans: n. 提示；付款期限；DOS命令：改变DOS系统提示符的风格
adj. 敏捷的，迅速的；立刻的
vt. 提示；促进；激起；（给演员）提白

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

sentences.english: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
sentences.chinese: 这学期你的作业在完成数量和质量上都有提高。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

name: relieve
trans: vt. 解除，减轻；使不单调乏味；换…的班；解围；使放心

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

name: remarkable
trans: adj. 卓越的；非凡的；值得注意的

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: remote
trans: adj. 遥远的；偏僻的；疏远的

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: reverse
trans: n. 背面；相反；倒退；失败
adj. 反面的；颠倒的；反身的

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

name: secure
trans: vt. 保护；弄到；招致；缚住
adj. 安全的；无虑的；有把握的；稳当的
vi. 获得安全；船抛锚；停止工作

sentences.english: There are no secure jobs these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今已经没有铁饭碗了。

sentences.english: We want a secure future for our children.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望我们的孩子未来生活无虞。

sentences.english: United’s position at the top of the league seems relatively secure.
sentences.chinese: 联队在联赛中的头名位置似乎相对稳固。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that is secure is one that you can depend on because it is not likely to change
to make something safe from being attacked, harmed, or lost

name: sharp
trans: adj. 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
adv. 急剧地；锐利地；突然地

sentences.english: Make sure you use a good sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要用锋利的好刀。

sentences.english: Its teeth are razor sharp (= very sharp ) .
sentences.chinese: 它的牙齿非常锋利。
