detailed_translations.english: one of the two periods of time that a year at high schools and universities is divided into, especially in the US

sentences.english: My wallet must be around here somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 我的钱包肯定是在这里的什么地方。

sentences.english: We could meet for dinner at Giorgio’s or somewhere (= or a similar place ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在乔治家或别的什么地方一起吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: in or to a place, but you do not say or know exactly where

name: surely
trans: adv. 当然；无疑；坚定地；稳当地

sentences.english: Such sinners will surely be punished.
sentences.chinese: 这样的罪人必定会受到惩罚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 当然；无疑；坚定地；稳当地
detailed_translations.english: certainly

sentences.english: the government’s economic and taxation policy
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济和税收政策

detailed_translations.english: the system of charging taxes

name: technician
trans: n. 技师，技术员；技巧纯熟的人

sentences.english: a laboratory technician
sentences.chinese: 实验室技术人员

sentences.english: a hospital technician
sentences.chinese: 医院技术人员

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to check equipment or machines and make sure that they are working properly

name: topic
trans: n. 主题（等于theme）；题目；一般规则；总论

sentences.english: The environment is a popular topic these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今环境是一个热门话题。

sentences.english: The main topic for discussion will be the proposed new supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 讨论的主要议题是拟建中的超级市场。

sentences.english: a wide range of topics
sentences.chinese: 广泛的话题

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目， 论题， 话题
detailed_translations.english: a subject that people talk or write about

name: unhealthy
trans: adj. 不健康的；危险的；有害身心健康的

sentences.english: unhealthy living conditions
sentences.chinese: 不利于健康的生活环境

detailed_translations.chinese: 不健康的；危险的；有害身心健康的
detailed_translations.english: likely to make you ill

name: unit
trans: n. 单位，单元；装置； 部队；部件

sentences.english: The family is the basic social unit of modern society.
sentences.chinese: 家庭是现代社会的基本单位。

sentences.english: control/display/filter etc unit
sentences.chinese: 控制/显示/过滤等装置

detailed_translations.english: a thing, person, or group that is regarded as one single whole part of something larger

name: unwilling
trans: adj. 不愿意的；不情愿的；勉强的

sentences.english: an unwilling helper
sentences.chinese: 勉强来帮忙的人

detailed_translations.english: not wanting to do something and refusing to do it

name: abstract
trans: n. 摘要；抽象；抽象的概念
vt. 摘要；提取；使……抽象化；转移(注意力、兴趣等)；使心不在焉

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: aggressive
trans: adj. 侵略性的；好斗的；有进取心的；有闯劲的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: amuse
trans: vt. 娱乐；消遣；使发笑；使愉快

sentences.english: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
sentences.chinese: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。

sentences.english: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们玩捉迷藏玩。

sentences.english: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
sentences.chinese: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone laugh or smile

name: approve
trans: vt. 批准；赞成；为…提供证据

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

sentences.english: He was arrested and charged with murder.
sentences.chinese: 他遭到逮捕并被指控谋杀。

sentences.english: I got arrested for careless driving.
sentences.chinese: 我因鲁莽驾驶被捕。

sentences.english: drugs used to arrest the spread of the disease
sentences.chinese: 用于控制疾病蔓延的药物

detailed_translations.english: if the police arrest someone, the person is taken to a  police station  because the police think they have done something illegal

name: assemble
trans: vt. 集合，聚集；装配；收集

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: attach
trans: vt. 使依附；贴上；系上；使依恋

sentences.english: When approving a merger, the commission can attach conditions.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在批准公司合并时可能附加条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缚， 系， 贴， 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

name: awful
trans: adj. 可怕的；极坏的；使人敬畏的

sentences.english: The weather was awful.
sentences.chinese: 天气很糟糕。

detailed_translations.english: very bad or unpleasant

name: barely
trans: adv. 仅仅，勉强；几乎不；公开地；贫乏地

sentences.english: She was barely aware of his presence.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎没有注意到他的存在。

sentences.english: Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
sentences.chinese: 乔和他哥哥几乎不说话。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: bargain
trans: v. 讨价还价；议价；(谈价钱后)卖

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

name: behave
trans: vi. 表现；（机器等）运转；举止端正；（事物）起某种作用
vt. 使守规矩；使表现得…

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

name: bother
trans: vt. 烦扰，打扰；使……不安；使……恼怒

sentences.english: Danny, don’t bother Ellen while she’s reading.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼，埃伦看书的时候不要去打扰她 。

sentences.english: You seem to have got yourself into a spot of bother.
sentences.chinese: 你似乎让自己遇上了点麻烦。

detailed_translations.english: to annoy, worry or upset sb
trouble or difficulty

name: bump
trans: vi. 碰撞，撞击；颠簸而行

sentences.english: She has a bump on the back of her head.
sentences.chinese: 她的后脑勺上肿起了一块。

sentences.english: He had a few injuries, mostly bumps and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 他有几处受了伤，大都是肿块和瘀青。

detailed_translations.english: an area of skin that is raised because you have hit it on something
to hit or knock against something

name: campaign
trans: vi. 作战；参加竞选；参加活动

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: channel
trans: vt. 引导，开导；形成河道

sentences.english: the news on Channel 4
sentences.chinese: 第四频道播出的新闻

sentences.english: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在看迪士尼频道的卡通片。

sentences.english: What channel is ‘ER’ on?
sentences.chinese: 《仁心仁术》在哪个频道播放？

sentences.english: He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 他转换频道看篮球比赛。

detailed_translations.english: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts

detailed_translations.chinese: 把〔钱、精力等〕导向〔特定目的〕；引导；把…用于
detailed_translations.english: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose

name: characterize
trans: vt. 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征

sentences.english: Bright colours characterize his paintings.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的色彩是他绘画作品的特点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征
detailed_translations.english: to describe the qualities of someone or something in a particular way

name: charity
trans: n. 慈善；施舍；慈善团体；宽容；施舍物

sentences.english: Several charities sent aid to the flood victims.
sentences.chinese: 有几家慈善机构已向洪灾灾民送去了救援物资。

detailed_translations.english: an organization that gives money, goods, or help to people who are poor, sick etc

sentences.english: The company engaged in a deliberate effort to cheat them out of their pensions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司曾蓄意诈取他们的养老金。

detailed_translations.english: If someone cheats you out of something, they get it from you by behaving dishonestly
to behave in a dishonest way in order to win or to get an advantage, especially in a competition, game, or examination

name: cite
trans: vt. 引用；传讯；想起；表彰

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

name: commercial
trans: adj. 商业的；营利的；靠广告收入的

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: computing
trans: n. 计算；处理；从事电脑工作
v. 计算（compute的现在分词形式）

name: construction
trans: n. 建设；建筑物；解释；造句

sentences.english: a road construction project
sentences.chinese: 道路修建计划

sentences.english: construction workers
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人

detailed_translations.english: the process of building things such as houses, bridges, roads etc

name: constructive
trans: adj. 建设性的；推定的；构造上的；有助益的

sentences.english: The meeting was very constructive.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议很有建设性。

sentences.english: We welcome any constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们欢迎任何有建设性的批评。

detailed_translations.english: useful and helpful, or likely to produce good results

sentences.english: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.
sentences.chinese: 如果症状持续的话，马上咨询医生。

sentences.english: Have you consulted a dictionary?
sentences.chinese: 你查过词典了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

name: convict
trans: vt. 证明…有罪；宣告…有罪

sentences.english: a convicted murderer
sentences.chinese: 已定罪的谋杀犯

sentences.english: an escaped convict
sentences.chinese: 越狱犯

detailed_translations.english: to prove or officially announce that someone is guilty of a crime after a trial in a law court
someone who has been proved to be guilty of a crime and sent to prison

name: counterpart
trans: n. 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: entry
trans: n. 进入；入口；条目；登记；报关手续；对土地的侵占

sentences.english: You can leave your umbrella in the entry.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把伞放在入口处。

sentences.english: More keyboarding staff are required for data entry.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的键盘录入人员来录入这些资料。

sentences.english: There was no sign of a forced entry.
sentences.chinese: 没有强行闯入的迹象。

sentences.english: How did the thieves gain entry (= get in )?
sentences.chinese: 窃贼是怎样进入的？

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate or passage where you enter a building; an entrance hall

name: evolutionary
trans: adj. 进化的；发展的；渐进的

sentences.english: the evolutionary development of birds
sentences.chinese: 鸟类的进化过程

sentences.english: Some scientists have rejected evolutionary theory.
sentences.chinese: 有些科学家拒绝接受进化论。

sentences.english: He is in favour of gradual, evolutionary social change.
sentences.chinese: 他支持渐进的社会变革。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the way in which plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

sentences.english: oil exploration facilities in the North Sea
sentences.chinese: 北海的石油勘探设施

sentences.english: You can then use this hut as a base for explorations into the mountains around.
sentences.chinese: 你到时可以把这间小屋当大本营，去周围的山里探险。

detailed_translations.english: the act of travelling through a place in order to find out about it or find something such as oil or gold in it

name: exposure
trans: n. 暴露；曝光；揭露；陈列

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: fairly
trans: adv. 相当地；公平地；简直

sentences.english: The house had a fairly large garden.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子有个不小的花园。

sentences.english: She speaks English fairly well.
sentences.chinese: 她英语讲得还不错。

sentences.english: I felt I hadn’t been treated fairly.
sentences.chinese: 我感到自己没有受到公正对待。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little, but much less than very

name: flexibility
trans: n. 灵活性；弹性；适应性

sentences.english: Employees expect flexibility in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 员工们盼望工作安排有弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to change or be changed easily to suit a different situation

name: flood
trans: vi. 涌出；涌进；为水淹没

sentences.english: The village was cut off by floods.
sentences.chinese: 那个村子因洪水而与外界中断了联系。

sentences.english: the worst floods for over fifty years
sentences.chinese: 五十多年来最严重的水灾

sentences.english: Towns and cities all over the country have been flooded.
sentences.chinese: 全国各地的城镇都被淹没了。

detailed_translations.english: a very large amount of water that covers an area that is usually dry
to cover a place with water, or to become covered with water

name: frame
trans: n. 框架；结构； 画面
adj. 有木架的；有构架的
vt. 设计；建造；陷害；使…适合

sentences.english: Newman played a central role in framing the new law.
sentences.chinese: 纽曼在拟定新法的过程中发挥了主要作用。

name: generous
trans: adj. 慷慨的，大方的；宽宏大量的；有雅量的

sentences.english: Dietler is generous with his time and money.
sentences.chinese: 迪特勒在他的时间和金钱方面慷慨大方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is generous is willing to give money, spend time etc, in order to help people or give them pleasure

name: grace
trans: n. 优雅；恩惠；魅力；慈悲

sentences.english: Lena moved with the grace of a dancer.
sentences.chinese: 莉娜走路姿势有着舞者般的优美。

sentences.english: He conducted himself with grace and dignity throughout the trial.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审讯过程中他表现得文雅而有尊严。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth way of moving that looks natural, relaxed, and attractive

sentences.english: The grief she felt over Helen’s death was almost unbearable.
sentences.chinese: 她因海伦的去世而悲痛难当。

detailed_translations.english: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died

name: hazard
trans: n. 危险，冒险；冒险的事
vt. 赌运气；冒…的危险，使遭受危险

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: incident
trans: adj.  入射的；附带的；易发生的，伴随而来的

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

sentences.chinese: 继承的财富

detailed_translations.english: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died
to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

name: integrate
trans: vi. 求积分；取消隔离；成为一体
vt. 使…完整；使…成整体；求…的积分；表示…的总和

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

name: justice
trans: n. 司法，法律制裁；正义；法官，审判员

sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

name: massive
trans: adj. 大量的；巨大的，厚重的；魁伟的

sentences.english: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

name: minimum
trans: n. 最小值；最低限度；最小化；最小量

sentences.english: This will take a minimum of one hour.
sentences.chinese: 这最少要用一个小时。

sentences.english: The minimum number of students we need to run the course is fifteen.
sentences.chinese: 我们开这门课程最少要有15个学生。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary
the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed

name: mobility
trans: n. 移动性；机动性； 迁移率

sentences.english: It improves the strength and mobility of joints.
sentences.chinese: 它能提高关节的力量和灵活性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to move easily from one job, area, or social class to another

name: moral
trans: adj. 道德的；精神上的；品性端正的

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.english: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

name: negotiate
trans: vt. 谈判，商议；转让；越过

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: occupation
trans: n. 职业；占有；消遣；占有期

sentences.english: Please state your name, address and occupation.
sentences.chinese: 请写明你的姓名、地址和职业。

sentences.english: professional and managerial occupations
sentences.chinese: 专业及管理工作

sentences.english: manual occupations
sentences.chinese: 体力工作

sentences.english: the German occupation of France
sentences.chinese: 德军对法国的占领

detailed_translations.english: a job or profession

name: overwhelm
trans: vt. 淹没；压倒；受打击；覆盖；压垮

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

name: personnel
trans: n. 人事部门；全体人员
adj. 人员的；有关人事的

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

name: plague
trans: n. 瘟疫；灾祸；麻烦；讨厌的人
vt. 折磨；使苦恼；使得灾祸

sentences.chinese: 资金问题持续困扰着该公司。

detailed_translations.english: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

sentences.english: Women in these jobs are paid less precisely because most of the jobs are held by women rather than men.
sentences.chinese: 从事这些工作的女性报酬之所以较低正是因为做这些工作的人大部分是女性而不是男性。

sentences.english: She’s precisely the kind of person we’re looking for.

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that a particular thing is completely true or correct

trans: adj. 主要的；初级的；基本的

sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: principal
trans: n. 首长；校长；资本；当事人

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: profound
trans: adj. 深厚的；意义深远的；渊博的

sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

trans: n. 性质，性能；财产；所有权

sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

sentences.english: raw meat
sentences.chinese: 生肉

sentences.english: grated raw carrots
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的生胡萝卜

sentences.english: Cabbage can be eaten raw.
sentences.chinese: 洋白菜可以生吃。

sentences.english: raw sugar
sentences.chinese: 原糖

detailed_translations.english: not cooked

trans: adj. 现实的；现实主义的；逼真的；实在论的

sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.

vt. 补充；聘用；征募；使…恢复健康

sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.

sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

name: religious
trans: adj. 宗教的；虔诚的；严谨的；修道的

sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: routinely
trans: adv. 例行公事地；老一套地

sentences.english: This vaccine is already routinely used.
sentences.chinese: 这种疫苗的使用已经常规化。

name: rush
trans: n. 冲进；匆促；急流；灯心草
vt. 使冲；突袭；匆忙地做；飞跃

sentences.english: A small girl rushed past her.
sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩从她身边匆匆经过。

sentences.chinese: 莫匆匆走过走廊。

name: saturate
trans: adj. 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的
vt. 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满

sentences.english: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满
detailed_translations.english: to make something very wet

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的

name: series
trans: n. 系列，连续； 串联；级数；丛书

sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

name: session
trans: n. 会议；（法庭的）开庭；（议会等的）开会；学期；讲习会

sentences.english: Board members met in closed session (= with nobody else present ) .
sentences.chinese: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

name: soar
trans: vi. 高飞；高耸；往上飞舞

sentences.english: Her temperature soared.
sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment
sentences.chinese: 急剧上升的失业率

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

name: specialize
trans: vi. 专门从事；详细说明；特化
vt. 使专门化；使适应特殊情况；详细说明

sentences.english: "I think the feedback can be helpful because we all have blinders on when we fall in love, " says Eva Ritvo, a Miami psychiatrist who specialize sin marriage and family therapy.
sentences.chinese: 专门从事婚姻与家庭疗法研究的迈阿密精神病专家瑞塔沃说：“我认为信息回馈是有用的，因为人们在恋爱时都会变得盲目。

sentences.english: The research work is being done by a small group of dedicated and imaginative scientists who specialize in extracting from various sea animals substances that may improve the health of the human race.
sentences.chinese: 一小部分富有想像力和敬业精神的科学家正在进行这项研究，他们专门研究从各种海洋动物中提取能增进人类健康的物质。

detailed_translations.english: to limit all or most of your study, business etc to a particular subject or activity

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应特殊目的， 使专用于

name: spiritual
trans: n. 圣歌（尤指美国南部黑人的）

sentences.english: Painting helps fill a spiritual need for beauty.
sentences.chinese: 绘画可以满足对美的精神需求。

sentences.english: spiritual values
sentences.chinese: 精神价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神的， 心灵的； 宗教的
detailed_translations.english: relating to your spirit rather than to your body or mind

sentences.english: We went out in spite of the rain.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下着雨，我们还是出去了。

sentences.english: Kelly loved her husband in spite of the fact that he drank too much.
sentences.chinese: 虽然丈夫酗酒，凯莉仍然爱着他。

sentences.english: She broke it just out of spite.
sentences.chinese: 她就是出于恶意把它打破的。

sentences.english: The neighbours throw things over the garden wall just to spite us.
sentences.chinese: 邻居把东西扔过花园围墙，故意和我们作对。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or prevented by something

name: sponsor
trans: n. 赞助者；主办者；保证人

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

sentences.english: a period of relative stability
sentences.chinese: 相对稳定的一段时期

detailed_translations.english: the condition of being steady and not changing

sentences.english: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我们的友谊逐年加深。

sentences.english: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

sentences.english: The company plans to strengthen its hand (= make itself more powerful ) in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

detailed_translations.english: to become stronger or make something stronger

name: strike
trans: vi. 打，打击；罢工；敲，敲击；抓；打动；穿透
vt. 打，击；罢工；撞击，冲击；侵袭；打动；到达

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

name: substantial
trans: adj. 大量的；实质的；内容充实的

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.english: The document requires substantial changes.
sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可观的， 大量的； 物质的， 坚固的； 实质的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

name: superior
trans: n. 上级，长官；优胜者，高手；长者
adj. 上级的；优秀的，出众的；高傲的

sentences.english: She had that superior tone of voice.
sentences.chinese: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上级的，较高的；优越的；有优越感的，高傲的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job

name: survival
trans: n. 幸存，残存；幸存者，残存物

sentences.english: The doctors gave him a one in ten chance of survival .
sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.english: The cult is a survival from the old Zoroastrian religion.
sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing to live or exist

name: swallow
trans: n. 燕子；一次吞咽的量

sentences.english: He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 他喝完最后一口咖啡，要求结账。

sentences.english: Most snakes swallow their prey whole .
sentences.chinese: 大多数蛇都是把猎物囫囵吞下。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach

sentences.english: She swiped me across the face.
sentences.chinese: 她扬起手打了我一个耳光。

detailed_translations.english: to hit or to try to hit someone or something by swinging your arm or an object very quickly
when you hit or try to hit someone or something by swinging your arm very quickly

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.

trans: n. 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.

detailed_translations.english: a small change made to a machine, system, or calculation

sentences.chinese: 警方给公共集会设置了条件。

sentences.english: Restrictions on freedom of assembly have gradually been relaxed.

sentences.chinese: 她的回答让我大吃一惊。

name: deed

sentences.chinese: 上午做了好事之后，他理应休息一下。

name: defense

sentences.chinese: 当然，我们将在前行道路上就每一步骤与我们的盟国密切磋商，因为我们欧洲和亚洲盟国的安全与防卫是不容讨价还价的。

sentences.chinese: 她现在和比她小10岁的演员丹尼斯·劳森同居。

sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

sentences.chinese: 美国邮政

sentences.english: an increase in postal charges

sentences.chinese: 飞机的螺旋桨在快速旋转。

sentences.chinese: 她坐在窗前纺线。

sentences.chinese: 天气的突然变化

sentences.chinese: 生活真残酷，她想，心头突然涌上一股怒气。

sentences.english: a sudden movement
sentences.chinese: 突然的一动

sentences.chinese: 她的死很突然。

sentences.chinese: 格里菲思密切指导该项研究。

sentences.chinese: 有效信用卡

sentences.chinese: 你的往返票有效期为三个月。

sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.chinese: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

name: accommodate

sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

sentences.chinese: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

sentences.chinese: 伯顿的敌人对他提出不实的指责。

sentences.chinese: 国务院就海外局势发布旅游警报。

name: attendance

sentences.chinese: 每场比赛平均有4,000名球迷来观战。

sentences.english: Last year’s fair saw attendance figures of 32,000.

detailed_translations.chinese: 出席；到场；出席人数；考勤

name: attorney

sentences.chinese: …一位公诉律师。

sentences.chinese: 我希望他现在醒着。

sentences.chinese: 我给她端去咖啡的时候，她还是半睡半醒的样子。

sentences.chinese: 那声音使他睡意全无。

sentences.chinese: 她醒来时已是中午。

name: belt
trans: vt. 用带子系住；用皮带抽打

sentences.chinese: 他解开皮带。

vt. 特写；以…为特色；由…主演

sentences.english: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
sentences.chinese: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.english: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.english: The hotel’s only redeeming features (= things that make it acceptable ) were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

sentences.english: One of the distinguishing features (= features that are different from other things of the same sort ) of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
sentences.chinese: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.english: It's a great film and it features a Spanish actor who is going to be a world star within a year.
sentences.chinese: 那是一部精彩的电影，它由一位西班牙演员主演，他一年之内就会成为国际明星。

sentences.english: The hour-long programme will be updated each week and feature highlights from recent games.
sentences.chinese: 这个一小时的节目将每周更新，重点介绍近期比赛的精彩部分。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特征，特色；面貌；特写，专题节目；故事片
detailed_translations.english: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it

name: fossil
trans: n. 化石；僵化的事物；顽固不化的人
adj. 化石的；陈腐的，守旧的

sentences.english: fossils of early reptiles
sentences.chinese: 早期爬行动物的化石

sentences.english: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ).
sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

name: increasingly
trans: adv. 越来越多地；渐增地

sentences.english: Marketing techniques are becoming increasingly sophisticated.
sentences.chinese: 市场营销技巧越来越巧妙。

sentences.english: Increasingly, young people distrust all forms of government.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人越来越不相信任何形式的政府。

detailed_translations.english: more and more all the time

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

name: mule
trans: n. 骡；倔强之人，顽固的人；杂交种动物

sentences.english: If I had that much money, I'd buy another mule.
sentences.chinese: 要是我有那么多钱，我早就另买一头骡子了。

sentences.english: Walking or riding on a mule, a tourist can look into the monasteries one by one.
sentences.chinese: 如果你步行或骑着骡子进山观光，沿途便呈现出一座又一座修道院。

sentences.english: First, through a pine forest, spurning the mule trail and the shortcuts, and sampling the blueberries; then through an alluvial cone, wasting precious energy.
sentences.chinese: 首先，穿过一片松树林，没在意骡子走过的足迹和捷径，品尝着蓝莓；然后穿过冲击堆，浪费了宝贵的精力。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that has a  donkey  and a horse as parents

sentences.english: So, what of the future of obesity in America?
sentences.chinese: 那么，未来美国的肥胖状况会怎么发展呢？

sentences.english: Dr.Watson is great on exercise as a cure for obesity.
sentences.chinese: 沃森医生把运动看做是治疗肥胖症的良方。

sentences.english: What is obesity?
sentences.chinese: 什么是肥胖？

detailed_translations.english: when someone is very fat in a way that is unhealthy

sentences.english: Despite their different personalities, they became the best of friends.
sentences.chinese: 尽管个性不同，他们还是成了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the illness can lead to changes in personality.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这种病会导致性格变化。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

name: release
trans: vt. 释放；发射；让与；允许发表

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: resource
trans: n. 资源，财力；办法；智谋

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: shift
trans: n. 移动；变化；手段；轮班

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: adviser
trans: n. 顾问；劝告者；指导教师（等于advisor）

sentences.english: a financial adviser
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

detailed_translations.chinese: 顾问；劝告者；指导教师（等于advisor）
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to give advice because they know a lot about a subject, especially in business, law, or politics

sentences.english: The new resort area has boosted tourism.
sentences.chinese: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动， 促进， 激励； 替…做广告， 宣扬； 提高， 使增长
detailed_translations.english: to increase or improve something and make it more successful
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

name: depress
trans: vt. 压抑；使沮丧；使萧条

sentences.english: The thought of taking the exam again depressed him.
sentences.chinese: 想到要补考，他就心情沮丧。

sentences.english: It depresses me that nobody seems to care.
sentences.chinese: 似乎没有人在乎，这让我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Depress the clutch fully.
sentences.chinese: 把离合器踩到底。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very unhappy

name: launch
trans: vt. 发射（导弹、火箭等）；发起，发动；使…下水
n. 发射；发行，投放市场；下水；汽艇

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: military
trans: adj. 军事的；军人的；适于战争的

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: panel
trans: n. 仪表板；嵌板；座谈小组，全体陪审员

sentences.english: A panel of experts has looked at the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 一组专家审核了那项提议。

sentences.english: There will be at least three senior doctors on the panel.
sentences.chinese: 专家小组中至少有三名资深医生。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people with skills or specialist knowledge who have been chosen to give advice or opinions on a particular subject

name: capture
trans: vt. 俘获；夺得；捕捉，拍摄,录制

sentences.english: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: financial
trans: adj. 金融的；财政的，财务的

sentences.english: financial transactions
sentences.chinese: 财务往来

sentences.english: financial assistance
sentences.chinese: 财务援助

sentences.english: a financial advisor
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

sentences.english: Organic farmers should be encouraged with financial incentives.
sentences.chinese: 应对实行有机栽培的农民给予经济上的鼓励。

sentences.english: It was a wonderful film, but not exactly a financial success (= something that makes a profit ) .
sentences.chinese: 这是一部出色的影片，但在票房上不是很成功。

detailed_translations.english: relating to money or the management of money

name: further
trans: adv. 进一步地；而且；更远地

sentences.english: They walked a little further.
sentences.chinese: 他们又往前走了一点。

sentences.english: His hands moved further down her back.
sentences.chinese: 他的手在她背上继续往下滑。

sentences.english: They’ve never been further south than San Diego.
sentences.chinese: 他们从没有到过比圣迭戈更往南的地方。

detailed_translations.english: a greater distance, or beyond a particular place
more or additional

name: crisis
trans: n. 危机；危险期；决定性时刻
adj. 危机的；用于处理危机的

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

sentences.english: Most Indian restaurants offer free delivery.
sentences.chinese: 大多数印度餐馆提供免费外送服务。

sentences.english: You can expect delivery in a week to ten days.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在一周至十天内收到货物。

sentences.english: fresh milk deliveries
sentences.chinese: 新鲜牛奶递送

sentences.english: Mrs Howell had an easy delivery.
sentences.chinese: 豪厄尔太太的分娩很顺利。

detailed_translations.english: the act of bringing goods, letters etc to a particular person or place, or the things that are brought

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

sentences.english: The fund was set up to try to save the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 设立基金以挽救大教堂。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is collected and kept for a particular purpose
to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc

sentences.english: In this instance I think she was mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上我认为她弄错了。

detailed_translations.english: an example of a particular kind of situation

name: negative
trans: adj.  负的；消极的；否定的；阴性的
n. 否定；负数； 底片

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: particularly
trans: adv. 特别地，独特地；详细地，具体地；明确地，细致地

sentences.english: Steve was in a particularly bad mood when he got back.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫回来时情绪特别不好。

sentences.english: The restaurant is particularly popular with young people.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅尤其受到年轻人的欢迎。

sentences.english: We are hoping to expand our business, particularly in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望扩大业务，尤其是在欧洲。

sentences.english: British farmers, particularly those producing lamb, are very worried.
sentences.chinese: 英国农场主，尤其是养羊羔的农场主，非常担忧。

detailed_translations.english: more than usual or more than others

sentences.english: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.
sentences.chinese: 教员是委员会推荐任命的。

sentences.english: We will review the case and make a recommendation to the client.
sentences.chinese: 我们将审查此案，然后向当事人提出建议。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion to someone that they should choose a particular thing or person that you think is very good

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

name: reveal
trans: n. 揭露；暴露；门侧，窗侧
vt. 显示；透露；揭露；泄露

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

sentences.english: There is no heating available due to fuel shortages.
sentences.chinese: 因为燃料短缺，所以没有供暖。

sentences.english: There is no shortage of funds.
sentences.chinese: 不缺资金。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is not enough of something that people need

sentences.english: a Scotch and soda
sentences.chinese: 一杯加苏打水的苏格兰威士忌

detailed_translations.chinese: 碳酸钠， 纯碱； 汽水， 苏打水
detailed_translations.english: water that contains bubbles and is often added to alcoholic drinks

sentences.english: the government’s long-term economic strategy
sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

name: wireless
trans: vt. 用无线电报与…联系；用无线电报发送
vi. 打无线电报；打无线电话

sentences.english: ...the fast-growing wireless communication market.
sentences.chinese: …快速增长的无线通讯市场。

detailed_translations.english: Wireless technology uses radio waves rather than electricity and therefore does not require any wires
a radio

detailed_translations.chinese: 用无线电报与…联系；用无线电报发送
打无线电报；打无线电话

name: assignment
trans: n. 分配；任务；作业；功课

sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

sentences.english: the very real historical and cultural differences between our two societies
sentences.chinese: 我们两个社会之间非常现实的历史和文化差异

sentences.english: the desire to maintain a distinct cultural identity
sentences.chinese: 保持独特的文化特征的愿望

sentences.english: It is important to look at the political and cultural context in which the novel was written.
sentences.chinese: 要考虑小说创作时的政治和文化背景，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: people who share the same cultural background
sentences.chinese: 有着相同文化背景的人

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to a particular society and its way of life

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: journal
trans: n. 日报，杂志；日记；分类账

sentences.english: the British Medical Journal
sentences.chinese: 《英国医学杂志》

sentences.english: He decided to keep a journal.
sentences.chinese: 他决定记日记。

detailed_translations.english: a serious magazine produced for professional people or those with a particular interest

name: mostly
trans: adv. 主要地；通常；多半地

sentences.english: Green teas are mostly from China or Japan.
sentences.chinese: 绿茶主要来自中国或日本。

sentences.english: There were about fifteen people in the lounge, mostly women.
sentences.chinese: 大厅里大约有15人，大部分是女性。

sentences.english: He blamed his parents. Mostly he blamed his dad.
sentences.chinese: 他责怪他的父母，主要是责怪他爸爸。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about most members of a group, most occasions, most parts of something etc

name: motivate
trans: vt. 刺激；使有动机；激发…的积极性

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: option
trans: n.  选项；选择权；买卖的特权

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

name: overall
trans: adj. 全部的；全体的；一切在内的

sentences.english: The overall cost of the exhibition was £400,000.
sentences.chinese: 展览会的全部费用是40万英镑。

sentences.english: The overall result is an increase in population.
sentences.chinese: 总的结果是人口增加。

sentences.english: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.
sentences.chinese: 总冠军和第二名被选了出来。

sentences.english: We don’t want all the details now, just the overall picture.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们不需要全部细节，只要知道大致的情况。

detailed_translations.english: heavy cotton trousers with a piece covering your chest, held up by pieces of cloth that go over your shoulders
considering or including everything

name: significant
trans: n. 象征；有意义的事物
adj. 重大的；有效的；有意义的；值得注意的；意味深长的

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: transfer
trans: n. 转让；转移；传递；过户

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: yoga
trans: n. 瑜珈（意为“结合”，指修行）；瑜珈术
n. 联想可360°翻转的超轻薄笔记本电脑

sentences.english: I do yoga twice a week.
sentences.chinese: 我一周做两次瑜伽。

detailed_translations.chinese: 瑜珈（意为“结合”，指修行）；瑜珈术
detailed_translations.english: a system of exercises that help you control your mind and body in order to relax

name: claim
trans: n. 要求；声称；索赔；断言；值得
vt. 要求；声称；需要；认领

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: enable
trans: vt. 使能够，使成为可能；授予权利或方法

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

name: saving
trans: adj. 节约的；挽救的；补偿的；保留的

sentences.english: Buying a house had taken all their savings.
sentences.chinese: 买房子花掉了他们所有的积蓄。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节省， 节约； 储蓄金， 存款
detailed_translations.english: all the money that you have saved, especially in a bank

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: collapse
trans: vt. 使倒塌，使崩溃；使萎陷；折叠

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

sentences.english: You have diabetes, or liver or kidney disease.
sentences.chinese: 有糖尿病，或者是有肝病或肾病者。

sentences.english: It is like diabetes or asthma, an illness, due to a build up of pressures, which can happen to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 就像是糖尿病或者哮喘，由于压力的形成，这种病有可能发生在任何人身上。

sentences.english: We can then translate this information into estimates of the current diabetes and cardiovascular disease that can be attributed to the rise in consumption of these drinks.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们可以将这些信息转变成对当前糖尿病和冠心病的估计，而这些疾病是软饮料消耗量的增加所导致的。

detailed_translations.english: a serious disease in which there is too much sugar in your blood

name: exhaust
trans: n. 排气；废气；排气装置
vt. 排出；耗尽；使精疲力尽；彻底探讨

sentences.english: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
sentences.chinese: 讲一整天课令我精疲力竭。

sentences.english: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
sentences.chinese: 我们面临世界石油储备耗尽的危险。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel extremely tired

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: intelligent
trans: adj. 智能的；聪明的；理解力强的

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: maintain
trans: vt. 维持；继续；维修；主张；供养

sentences.english: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.english: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

name: management
trans: n. 管理；管理人员；管理部门；操纵；经营手段

sentences.english: a lack of management skills
sentences.chinese: 缺乏管理技巧

sentences.english: a management consultant
sentences.chinese: 一个管理顾问

sentences.english: management training courses
sentences.chinese: 管理培训课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理； 处理； 管理部门， 管理人员
detailed_translations.english: the activity of controlling and organizing the work that a company or organization does

name: necessarily
trans: adv. 必要地；必定地，必然地

sentences.english: The care of old people necessarily involves quite a lot of heavy lifting.
sentences.chinese: 照顾老年人必定要干很多搬重物的活儿。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided

name: source
trans: n. 来源；水源；原始资料

sentences.english: They get their money from various sources.
sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

sentences.english: Spouses were invited to the company picnic.
sentences.chinese: 配偶受到邀请参加公司的野餐会。

detailed_translations.english: a husband or wife

name: transportation
trans: n. 运输；运输系统；运输工具；流放

sentences.english: The city needs to improve its public transportation (= buses, trains etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 这座城市需要改善公共交通。

detailed_translations.english: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

name: vary
trans: vt. 改变；使多样化；变奏

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: counterpart
trans: n. 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: emotional
trans: adj. 情绪的；易激动的；感动人的

sentences.english: She provided emotional support at a very distressing time for me.
sentences.chinese: 在我非常痛苦的时候，她是我的情感支柱。

sentences.english: Ann suffered from depression and a number of other emotional problems.
sentences.chinese: 安患了抑郁症，还遇到一些其他的情绪问题。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional state of the patient
sentences.chinese: 患者的生理和情绪状态

sentences.english: The funeral was a very emotional experience for all of us.
sentences.chinese: 那次葬礼对我们大家来说都是一次无比伤感的经历。

sentences.english: He became very emotional when we had to leave.
sentences.chinese: 当我们不得不离开时，他非常伤感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 情绪(上)的，情感(上)的；激起感情的； 敏感的；情绪激动的〔尤指哭泣〕
detailed_translations.english: relating to your feelings or how you control them

name: environmental
trans: adj. 环境的，周围的；有关环境的

sentences.english: the environmental damage caused by the chemical industry
sentences.chinese: 化学工业对环境造成的破坏

sentences.english: an international meeting to discuss environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 探讨环境问题的国际会议

sentences.english: the environmental impact of pollution from cars
sentences.chinese: 汽车造成的污染对环境的影响

sentences.english: an environmental group
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织

detailed_translations.english: concerning or affecting the air, land, or water on Earth

name: executive
trans: n. 总经理；执行委员会；执行者；经理主管人员
adj. 行政的；经营的；执行的，经营管理的

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: federal
trans: adj. 联邦的；同盟的；联邦政府的； 联邦制的

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: foundation
trans: n. 基础；地基；基金会；根据；创立

sentences.english: It took the builders three weeks to lay the foundations .
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人花了三星期的时间打地基。

sentences.english: The earthquake shook the foundations of the house.
sentences.chinese: 地震动摇了那幢房子的地基。

sentences.english: the British Heart Foundation
sentences.chinese: 英国心脏病基金会

detailed_translations.english: the solid layer of  cement  , bricks, stones etc that is put under a building to support it

sentences.english: human genes
sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.english: the genes that regulate cell division
sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

detailed_translations.english: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

name: image
trans: n. 影像；想象；肖像；偶像
vt. 想象；反映；象征；作…的像

sentences.english: attempts to improve the image of the police
sentences.chinese: 提升警察形象的努力

sentences.english: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
sentences.chinese: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

name: immune
trans: adj. 免疫的；免于……的，免除的

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: interaction
trans: n. 相互作用； 交互作用

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只能在实现所有方法的情况下获得最大收益，因为它们的力量来自它们之间的交互。

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只有在实现所有方法的情况下才能获得最多的收益，因为它们的力量来自于它们之间的相互作用。

sentences.english: The real power of the concept comes not from any one of these devices; it emerges from the interaction of all of them.
sentences.chinese: 这个概念的很正力量并不来自于这些设备的任何一个；它来自于这些设备之间的交互。

detailed_translations.english: a process by which two or more things affect each other

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: leadership
trans: n. 领导能力；领导阶层

sentences.english: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
sentences.chinese: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。

sentences.english: the Conservative leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 保守党的领导人角逐

sentences.english: The next leadership election is due in November.
sentences.chinese: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

detailed_translations.english: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

sentences.english: The business is located right in the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店就在市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or place

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: previous
trans: adj. 以前的；早先的；过早的

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

detailed_translations.english: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

name: vulnerable
trans: adj. 易受攻击的，易受…的攻击；易受伤害的；有弱点的

sentences.english: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

name: alert
trans: adj. 警惕的，警觉的；留心的
vt. 警告；使警觉，使意识到

sentences.english: The animal raised its head, suddenly alert.
sentences.chinese: 那只动物突然警觉地抬起头来。

sentences.english: Taking notes is one of the best ways to stay alert in lectures.
sentences.chinese: 记笔记是听课时集中注意力的最佳方法之一。

detailed_translations.english: giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc
to make someone realize something important or dangerous

detailed_translations.chinese: 警戒， 戒备； 警报
detailed_translations.english: a warning to be ready for possible danger

name: capacity
trans: n. 能力；容量；资格，地位；生产力

sentences.english: The room had seating capacity for about 80.
sentences.chinese: 这房间能坐80个人左右。

sentences.english: The orchestra played to a capacity crowd (= the largest number of people who can fit into a hall, theatre etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队为满场的观众演奏。

sentences.english: All the hotels were filled to capacity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宾馆都住满了。

sentences.english: a child’s capacity for learning
sentences.chinese: 孩子的学习能力

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space a container, room etc has to hold things or people

sentences.english: Drinking water supplies are believed to have been contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 据信饮用水已受到污染。

detailed_translations.english: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

name: council
trans: n. 委员会；会议；理事会；地方议会；顾问班子

sentences.english: the council for civil liberties
sentences.chinese: 公民自由委员会

sentences.english: the UN Security Council
sentences.chinese: 联合国安全理事会

detailed_translations.english: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

name: entertain
trans: vt. 娱乐；招待；怀抱；容纳

sentences.english: A museum should aim to entertain as well as educate.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆应该致力于成为娱乐和教育功能并重的场所。

sentences.english: Mark usually does the cooking when we entertain.
sentences.chinese: 我们招待客人时通常都是马克下厨。

sentences.english: Do you get an allowance for entertaining clients?
sentences.chinese: 你招待客户有补助吗？

detailed_translations.english: to amuse or interest people in a way that gives them pleasure

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

sentences.english: a country estate
sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

detailed_translations.chinese: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

name: highly
